questionsData.title: The high numbers on the pH scale show high acidity.
questionsData.explain_answer: The pH scale The strength of an acid or alkali is measured on the pH scale. This measures the concentration of hydrogen ions on a scale of 0 to 14. Low numbers show high acidity. On this scale and 1.5 falls well within that range.

questionsData.title: Steam and vapour are gases.
A concave lens is an example of reflection.
Ultrasonic sound allows bats to see in the dark.
Protection against a disease is called immunity.
Lunar eclipse is the sun's eclipse.
A fish is covered in fur.
Camels have humps on their back.
An eagle's claw is on its head
questionsData.explain_answer: Eagles, like other birds of prey, have their claws (also called talons) on their feet.

questionsData.title: Wed and marry are synonyms.
A "brilliant dream" means "wonderful dream".
A fault line is a place where two plates meet.
To take charge is to take responsibility.
"Spare time interests" means "hope".
The synonym of "turn down" is " to accept"
Salary is the amount of money that is not paid.
questionsData.explain_answer: Salary is the amount of money that is paid.

questionsData.title: To grill meat, you place it under the heat.
Baharat and spices are antonyms.
A big ship which transports petrol is tanker.
Pirates are people who save ships.
The text is mainly talking about ……….. inventors.
questionsData.article: When we think of famous inventors we usually think of men, people like Alexander Graham Bell and Thomas Edison. But, when we talk about many of things that make our life easier today, we find that they were invented by women. For example, the car was invented by a man, but a woman called Mary Anderson, who in 1903 solved one of the biggest problems of driving, invented windshield (wipers 1) to help the drivers to see when it is raining or snowing. In 1956, Bette Nesmith was working as a secretary. She used to make typing mistakes, then she had a brilliant idea, which was to use a white liquid to paint over mistakes. Her invention is called white-out. In 1966, Stephanie Kwolek invented Keverlar, a special material that was very light, but stronger than metal, this material is used to make bullet-proof vests to (protect 2) police officers, soldiers, and politicians all over the world.( Her 3) invention saved thousands of lives.

questionsData.explain_answer: "driving" is the present participle form of the verb "drive." It is used to describe an ongoing action or activity.

questionsData.title: You ……be Ali's father, because you look like him.
Depend on ……………. .
Have Ahmed . . . the door.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
